sentence.text: Evaluation of drug-drug interaction between the novel cPLA2 inhibitor AK106-001616 and methotrexate in rheumatoid arthritis patients.
Drug interaction potential between AK106-001616, a novel cytosolic phospholipase A2 inhibitor, and methotrexate (MTX) in rheumatoid arthritis patients was investigated
This trial is registered with ClinicalTrials

In the clinical study, the 90% confidence intervals (CIs) for the geometric mean ratio (GMR) of AUC0-t of MTX administered after AK106-001616 200 mg compared to the MTX without AK106-001616 were within 80-125%
However, administration of AK106-001616 at doses of 400 and 600 mg exceeded the 125% threshold
As small but statistically significant increases in AUC0-t were observed, we investigated the mechanism for this drug-drug interaction between MTX and AK106-001616
6 μM) in a non-competitive manner and OAT3 (IC50 = 1
Both transporters are involved in MTX transport in renal proximal tubules
AK106-001616 has a weak drug interaction with MTX
In vitro studies provide a mechanistic understanding of the in vivo inhibition of transporters by AK106-001616
